intro: Castilleja exserta var. exserta, commonly known as the exserted paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it partially relies on other plants for water and nutrients. The plant features showy, red to orange tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and grasslands. The species is part of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its parasitic and hemiparasitic members.
